page.title: 20HISTORIC HOUSE PART 2
page.content: There are many reminders of the houses first owner e.g. the stair heads have got the Molesworth crest carved on them and one of the many stained glass windows has got H.H.M engraved on it,standing for Henry Hugh Molesworth.Another window has got Saint Patrick kneeling in prayer,holding a gold cup. The nursery and chapel have now been changed into a flat which is let. The house alone covers a quarter of an acre and the gardens three quarters of an acre.The gardens have got stone statues and garden benches.There is the remains of a bridge that went across the road to more gardens. The old stables that use to house horses now are used to store the old furniture from the house.The kennels where the gundogs were kept are now garages.
